pullRequest.body:
This sigma-algebra can be inferred from context and will be filled in non-canonically in the context of Gibbs measures.

From GibbsMeasure


---

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11893968148/job/33140138173)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11893968148/job/33140138601)

```suggestion
variable {m0 : MeasurableSpace Œ±} {mŒ≤ : MeasurableSpace Œ≤} [MeasurableSpace Œ≥]
```
Should `MeasurableSpace Œ±` be found by unification here? Should we add a notation for "`map` with a given œÉ-algebra in the codomain"?

> Should `MeasurableSpace Œ±` be found by unification here?

It can't be found by unfication if `Œº` isn't provided and `f` is a polymorphic function. It happens quite often in mathlib, as I discovered in a previous PR similar to this one but for the `MeasurableSpace Œ±` arguments.

> Should we add a notation for "`map` with a given œÉ-algebra in the codomain"?

I would like to, but I don't know what it should be. `map[mŒ±, mŒ≤]` sounds... ambiguous. It would be great if we could somehow generally make `f[a, b]` notation for `@f _ _ a _ b` where the `a` and `b` go fill in the first instance arguments of `f`.

For now, I suggest we merge this PR without any new notation

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: make sigma-algebra implicit in the `Measure.map` API
